alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 10:00PM EDT until September 11 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Delaware...southern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in northern Delaware...New Castle. In southern New Jersey... Gloucester and Salem. In southeast Pennsylvania...Delaware. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Wilmington, West Deptford, Pennsville, Carneys Point, Paulsboro, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem, Swedesboro, Delaware City, and Beckett. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 2. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 21. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
